summary: Cynthia Sue Cooper was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). The documents provided are payroll and certification reports from April, August, and December of 1978. These reports list her name, salary, and pay during those periods. The documents do not specify her role within the committee, but her presence on the payroll indicates she was a staff member.
significance: Cynthia Sue Cooper's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating her involvement in the investigation, though the specific nature and impact of her role are not detailed in these documents.
